intro: Garcinia schlecbteri, commonly known as the African mango or butter fruit, is a tropical plant native to central and western Africa. It is a small evergreen tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall, characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant produces yellow-orange berries that contain a single large seed, surrounded by a fleshy, aromatic pulp. Garcinia schlecbteri is valued for its fruit, which is used in traditional medicine and as a food source. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and economic contexts in its native region.
